TopicSection.Content:
You can add action columns in Spread.Views whose names, style and behavior can be customized. By default every action is displayed as a button.

Each action is an object, which contains 'name','presenter' and 'handler'.

The following image shows an example of Action Columns:

JavaScript JS var action = {
    name:string, //MUST. Indicate the action name.
    handler:function //MUST. It will be triggered when users click the action button.
    presenter: string, //OPTIONAL. Users can custom the style of action button. At the same time, Users need to add 'data-action' attribute in presenter, and set action name as its value.
}

You can get 'args' by handler function. It contains:

  • hitInfo
  • dataItem
  • gridModel

Actions contain built-in actions such as 'edit' and 'cancel'. The 'edit' action enables editing and 'cancel' action cancels the edit status.

If there is an 'edit' action, then by clicking the 'edit' button you can enter into editing status, at the same time, 'edit' button changes to 'save' button. In this case, only by clicking 'save' button you can save data. Clicking another row will not exit the edit status.

The 'action' property can be a string or an array. There are several ways to invoke build-in actions. 

  1. action: 'edit'
  2. action: ['edit' , 'cancel']
  3. action: [{name: 'edit' }]

You can change the built-in button style by modifying 'gc-action' class.
